title: Video Design for Self-Directed Mathematics Learning: Applying Gagné’s Events of Instruction

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding basic arithmetic operations and fundamental algebraic concepts
context.additional_context: Smartphone-based learning environment, strengthening the ability to apply mathematical concepts through project-based assessment

learning_goals: Learners can explain mathematical concepts (e.g., linear equations, function graphs) with 80% accuracy through videos applying Gagné’s nine events of instruction.
Learners achieve over 70% problem-solving proficiency in calculation tasks required for real-world job scenarios by utilizing interactive elements (quizzes, problem-solving) within videos.
Learners can correct misconceptions through feedback mechanisms and apply video learning content to project tasks at a rate of 60% or higher.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
